CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas Shelton, steelworker, 2245 Hallett Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "In time, smoking will have a bad effect on the lungs, therefore, I do not think that parents should allow teen-agers to smoke."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thomas Shelton wearing dark hat, plaid shirt, and belted trench coat, standing in front of stone building with store window with signs that read "35c Banana Split 40c and Cherry 30c"
